arcade.env.comp

Class GraphSites

  • java.lang.Object
    • arcade.env.comp.Sites
      • arcade.env.comp.GraphSites
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Component, java.io.Serializable, sim.engine.Steppable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RectGraphSites, TriGraphSites

    public abstract class GraphSites
extends Sites
    Extension of Sites for graph sites.

    Graph can be initialized in two ways (GRAPH_LAYOUT):

    • root layout grown from a specified root system using motifs
    • pattern layout that matches the structure used by PatternSites

    Roots are specified for the left (-x direction, ROOTS_LEFT), right (+x direction, ROOTS_RIGHT), top (-y direction, ROOTS_TOP), and bottom (-y direction, ROOTS_BOTTOM) sides of the environment. Specifications for each side depend on the layout where # indicates a number and X is A/a for an artery or V/v for a vein.

    • S = single roots, #X for a root of type X a distance # percent across the specified side
    • A = alternating roots, # for # evenly spaced roots alternating between artery and vein
    • R = random roots, # for # randomly spaced roots, randomly assigned as artery or vein
    • L = line roots, #X# for root of type X started # percent (first number) across the specified side and spanning # percent (second number) across the environment in the direction normal to the side
    Since:
    2.3
    Version:
    2.3.70
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GraphSites

        GraphSites(MiniBox component)
        Creates a Sites object with graph sites.

        Specifications include:

        • GRAPH_LAYOUT = graph layout type
        • ROOTS_LEFT = graph roots on left side of environment
        • ROOTS_TOP = graph roots on top side of environment
        • ROOTS_RIGHT = graph roots on right side of environment
        • ROOTS_BOTTOM = graph roots on bottom side of environment
        Parameters:
        component - the parsed component attributes

               int x,

        Checks if the given coordinates are within the environment to add to list.

        z - the coordinate in the z direction

      • complexStep

        void complexStep()
        Graph step that uses traversals to calculate exact hemodynamics.

        Traversing the graph updates the concentrations of molecules in each edge. The amount of concentration added is a function of flow rate and permeability to the given molecule.

      • createGrowthSites

        abstract GraphSites.Root createGrowthSites(GraphSites.Border border,
                                           double perc,
                                           int type,
                                           double frac,
                                           int scale)
        Creates a GraphSites.Root for graph sites using a root layout.
        Parameters:
        border - the border the root extends from
        perc - the percentage distance across the border the root is located
        type - the root type
        frac - the fraction distance in the perpendicular direction the root extends
        scale - the graph resolution scaling
        Returns:
        a GraphSites.Root object

      • equip

        public void equip(MiniBox molecule,
                  double[][][] delta,
                  double[][][] current,
                  double[][][] previous)
        Equips a molecule to the sites.

        For each molecule, the following parameters are required:

        • CONCENTRATION = source concentration of molecule
        • PERMEABILITY = permeability of molecule
        Specified by:
        equip in class Sites
        Parameters:
        molecule - the molecule parameters
        delta - the array holding changes in concentration
        current - the array holding current concentration values
        previous - the array holding previous concentration values

      • makePatternSites

      • makeSites

        public void makeSites(Simulation sim)
        Creates sites.

        Initializes a new Graph object representing the graph sites. Calls the correct method to population the graph with edges (either pattern or root layout). After the graph is defined, the corresponding indices in the lattice adjacent to edges are marked as sites.

        Specified by:
        makeSites in class Sites
        Parameters:
        sim - the simulation instance.

      • mergePatternSites

        private void mergePatternSites()
        Merges the edges in the graph with a pattern layout.

      • newGraph

        abstract Graph newGraph()
        Creates a new Graph to represent sites.
        Returns:
        a graph object

        offset - the offset direction
        scale - the graph resolution scaling
        Returns:
        an offset node

        Returns:

        public void setGraph(Graph graph)
        Sets the Graph representing the sites.
        Parameters:
        graph - the graph object

      • simpleStep

        void simpleStep()
        Graph step that only considers differences in concentration.

        Method is equivalent to the step used with SourceSites and PatternSites where the amount of concentration added is the difference between the source concentration and the current concentration for a given molecule.

      • stepGraph

        private void stepGraph(int code)
        Steps through graph to calculate concentrations and partial pressures.
        Parameters:
        code - the molecule code

      • subdivideGrowthSites

        private sim.util.Bag subdivideGrowthSites(int level)
        Subdivides the graph edges by splitting each edge in half.
        Parameters:
        level - the graph resolution level
        Returns:
        the bag of edge midpoint nodes

      • toJSON

        public java.lang.String toJSON()
        Represents object as a JSON entry.

        The JSON is formatted as: 

             {
         "type": "SITE",
         "class": "graph",
         "specs" : {
             "SPEC_NAME": spec value,
             "SPEC_NAME": spec value,
             ...
         }
     }
        Returns:
        the JSON string

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • traverseEdge

        private java.util.ArrayList<GraphSites.SiteNode> traverseEdge(GraphSites.SiteNode node,
                                                              int code)
        Traverses through the graph based on edges.
        Parameters:
        node - the current node being traversed
        code - the molecule code
        Returns:
        a list of children nodes to traverse

      • traverseNode

        private java.util.ArrayList<GraphSites.SiteNode> traverseNode(GraphSites.SiteNode node,
                                                              int code)
        Traverse through the graph based on nodes.
        Parameters:
        node - the current node being traversed
        code - the molecule code
        Returns:
        a list of children nodes to traverse

      • updateComponent

        public void updateComponent(Simulation sim,
                            Location oldLoc,
                            Location newLoc)
        Updates the component with old and new locations.

        Graph sites do not use this method to model damage. Instead, use the DegradeComponent and/or the RemodelComponent to introduce degradation and remodeling.

        Parameters:
        sim - the simulation instance
        oldLoc - the old location
        newLoc - the new location

      • updateGrowthSites

        private void updateGrowthSites(java.util.ArrayList<GraphSites.Root> arteries,
                               java.util.ArrayList<GraphSites.Root> veins,
                               int scale,
                               int level)
        Updates hemodynamic properties for graph sites with root layouts.
        Parameters:
        arteries - the list of artery edges
        veins - the list of vein edges
        scale - the graph resolution scaling
        level - the graph resolution level

      • updateSpans

        private void updateSpans()
        Iterates through the graph to draw span sites.

        Each edge is assigned a list of molecule fractions and transport for graph traversals. Edges that are not perfused are not included.
